revised_title: Investigating the Causes and Mechanisms of Inflammatory Stasis
tldr: The author examines the causes and mechanisms of inflammatory stasis, a form of blood stasis that occurs due to a modification of the blood plasma. The study focuses on the role of diosmosis, fluid withdrawal from capillaries, and the resulting local changes in the blood plasma, leading to the cohesion of corpuscles and the formation of inflammatory stasis.
